reviewText:
I've played Assasins vs Pirates for a while today and I can say a word or two about that game.

PROS:
- Easy to learn, hard to master gameplay
- Eye catching & funny 2D graphic
- Really nice music (really!)
- 4 different maps & 3 different game modes so it gives 12 unique gameplays (I hope for new maps in updates :) )
- Local mixed with multiplayer, perfect for hanging with friends or to play online
- The one thing that makes this game unique in some way
- In some modes maps can change a little during gameplay so it affects a lot on a tactical aspect of this game

CONS:
- Too few players for now (hope it will change in a days)
- No lobby and chat (hope it will change in updates)

TO SUM UP:
Assasins vs Pirates is a worth buying and a worth playing game. Unique gameplay, nice graphics and beautiful music are the core elements of it. You won't regret.

reviewText:
It's alright.

Coming up on the two-hour mark I feel happy with my money spent. Assuming, that is, that there are some updates coming soon.

It's nicely fast paced with some interesting mechanics that are simple enough to pick up quickly. The game does feel very impersonal though. Aside from some vague instructions, there's a complete lack of in-game chat, and the kill feed just shows two columns of unnamed avatars. It would also be nice if there was a clearer indicator of when I'd died. A number of times I've found myself trying to control a similar looking character standing next to my corpse.

Despite the game promoting a team-based experience, the most fun I've had so far was in a 1v1 game. The maps are very small, and having just a few more players can be enough to make it hard to see what's going on, but having just one opponent and no teammates allowed me to utilise the full map and actually become more involved in what I was doing.

Oh yeah, and bugs.
The first I encountered left my respawn invulnerability animation repeating for the rest of the game, leaving me able to kill and be killed, but not able to pick up the coins needed to win the match.
The second bug I found actually rendered me completely invulnerable. This grew boring however, as soon as I realised I was unable to attack either.

It's definitely a good game. The thing I want added most right now in it is just some more content.

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a78WaYxZRh8



Assassins vs Pirates is a fun couch co-op arena game. Online lobbies are pretty much empty so I can't stress enough, if you have friends to play this game, whether local or online, its a MUST HAVE. If you dont have people to play with, I suggest you wait till the price drops a bit, because it is an extremely easy to grasp fun game but the lack of bots makes it heavily reliant on other people.

reviewText: Haven't played too much so far but it's definitely interesting. Mechanics are simple, although controls take some time to get used to and to master (I'm still learning), There is a decent amount of maps and modes to play, the graphics are nice and the music is pleasing to the ears. It lacks single player mode though and there aren't that many players online so far so if you don't have friends who also own this game you need to reconsider buying this game. Also, since there are no categories for players you may end up against a true master and be slaughtered. Still I recommend trying this game because it is fun, just be sure to not reach 2h limit in case you think it's not your cup of tea.

reviewText:
I'll write this recomendation in pros & cons system, so ...

pros:
+music gives a great atmosphere, atmosphere of pirate adventures
+it's very playable, especially with close friends
+system of figthing is very easy and plausible, i had to spent a few minutes to learn how it works, but then real fight begun
+graphic is very colorful 2d, i don't know why, but for me it's simmilar to the Worms
+new skins to unlock which differ in different colors and all of them are original in some way
+diversified systems of play, 3 or 4 different game modes, my favorite is the building one (quite original)
+dynamic play, without any particular stops or pauses
+accesible interface, simple, but not too simple structure
+nice animations, but only few

cons:
-price/content
-information on the right side of the screen (who killed who)
-lost of fps
-small amount of maps
-i propose to change or add a few completley new perks, simillar to bomb and line
-information about the end of the round and list of winners is too short in time

reviewText:
I have only played this with a controller, with a few friends locally, and a few randoms online, but man is it fun!

I think the way the theme alludes to Assassins Creed is really well done, and overall holds together well.

It almost feels like a hardcore party game, and whatever button you press to jump, that finger is going to get a workout.

You need to jump to attack. If you land too early, you're probably dead. If you jump too far, you're probably dead. You control where you land by whether or not you are still holding jump, which means you can get tricky 'falling' through the building or stopping suddenly.

It definitely takes some getting used to, and the in-game instructions could be a bit clearer. But the most crucial thing is that it is fun to learn.

Also, it is great that if the game is public, people can join mid game - it means if you have enough local players or online friends, you're not waiting around in a lobby for more people.
- although at the moment, there aren't so many players. I'm not sure if regions effect anything, but I'm playing from Australia.

The only thing left this game needs is a community of at least casual players. So come join us!

It's an extremely fun and pretty game. The pace of the game is really different between 1v1 and 4v4 - some game modes in the latter case turn into real bloodsheds. It's a pity there are too few players to play online, because I'd definitely like to spend more time jumping and slashing. Thankfully there's also a couch co-op.

PROS:
- easy to learn
- great music
- beautiful graphic
- the controls are unique

CONS:
- the controls are unique
- noone to play with online
